info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 4:14PM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
info.description:
At 414 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Metairie, moving east at 15 mph.
HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Metairie, Avondale, Marrero, Harvey, Jefferson, Harahan, Westwego, Elmwood, Bridge City, River Ridge, Ama, Waggaman, St. Rose, Destrehan, Luling, and New Orleans Armstrong Airport.
This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 216 and 235. Interstate 310 between mile markers 1 and 4. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 3.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
If on or near marine areas, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL ST. CHARLES, WEST CENTRAL ORLEANS AND NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON PARISHES THROUGH 445 PM CDT

area.areaDesc: St. Charles; Western Orleans; Upper Jefferson
